name: Lamia Must Die
description: A horrible monster has been terrorizing the local town for years, doing terrible, unspeakable things to the citizen. One day, a paladin leads several other heroes towards the cave where the monster lies in, them being the final hope for the town of Clearmill and to save it from total devastation.

reviews.review_text: It's a short game that contains no grinding BS and let's you just get straight to the boss and attempt to fight it.

This is a great game when you are bored and you want to do something that doesn't take a very long time to complete. Also this game have great voice acting and a really cool feeling of an old retro rpg game. This game has many great possibilities but I haven't heard of anything else. Anyway I recommend it for EVERYONE!!!!!   *it isn't hard*

This game was really fun! If it was a full length game I would be all over this! I loved the choice between turn based combat and a more action type combat, which was done rather well in my opinion. I highly recommend this to anyone looking for a fun 30ish mins to kill.
A great time killer. But it is very short and feels like a foundation to a much bigger and greater game. Attention to the characters backstorys and themselfs are great.  Would highly recommend.

While Lamia Must Die is a good game, and a good concept, the story itself is lacking. Where's the gameplay between the intro and the boss battle? And the turn system makes it hard to come up with a strategy. Plus Lamia is a bit OP'd in this game. Adding gameplay between the intro and the battle with Lamia would have helped the party gather strength to face her. On top of that, I can't see the top part of Lamia, or the characters when I pull a super on her. That needs to be fixed.  However, on a good point, the voice acting is spot-on, showing the characters' emotions. I played as Ursula and she came off as one of those characters who tries to find sympathy for the antagonist in a hope to change her. However, she does come to her senses and realises that Lamia cannot be redeemed. I also like that the assassin character is vengeful in her quest, the priest is a good healer, and the Paladin has a good sense of justice. So the redeeming points lie mainly in the characters. And kudos to Lamia's voice acting, which gives a daemonic vibe.  I give this game a 5/10. Good, but still has a ways to go, and could use some improvements. My recommendation rating remains neutral.
Cared more about this little town in the half hour I played it than most games now fail to accomplish in more the 8 hours.
the first battle is pretty much impossible

Overall the game is fine because it is free but you really just play one battle and that is it. The battle is really easy, voice acting was awful, and it was all over in like 15 minutes. What was the point of this? If it was a full game and no voice acting it might be something worth playing.
Not worth your time. It's one battle, worthless voice acting, no real plot. One of the most pathetic things I've ever seen.

Started the story. Stared down anime knockers immediately. Mediocred the hell out.

for what is was, it was cool and creative but is little dissapointing in some aspects (i respect that this was a contest game and these things i mention cannot be helped) there was no build up to the fight exept from a useless bit of dialog explaining backstory and is really aggrivating and you realize that the game is over, i found it more satisfactory when i died. a tutorial or something related. but if we consider why ts so lacking it becomes amazing. for the time you had on this devolepers its a good game
Great game, greater story. Truly awe inspiring to say the least. Makes me want to work hard on my own Rpg Maker game. Recmmended highly i must say. Thank you for such a game. :)
It was ok for a contest entry, but not really a game I would recommend for others to play. At least it was for free, though.
Nice, short, free game. Shows potential.

TL;DR : creative but lacks polish 6.5/10 Single-battle rpg for free! Despite the fact that the game literally throws the player into the action with a complex UI (especially, for those who never touched RPG Maker in their lives), and no explanation of the items; this short game has quality voice-acting, creative skills and cutscenes, and creative ways of using the default engine. Overall, you'll probably won't like the game, but I'd still suggest you give it a go. If you use any RPG Maker, this is a must-play game for it's sheer creativity alone, I give it a 6.5/10.
